titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Henry Hunt Letter, 1881
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letter by Hunt to the Acting Attorney General, S.F. Phillips, regarding the case of William Wallace. Wallace, a Captain in the U.S. Marine Corps, had evidently brought suit against the Navy Department for its alleged non-payment of salary increments.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: William Henry Hunt letter, 1881, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: William Henry Hunt was Secretary of the Navy, 1881-1882.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letter by Hunt to the Acting Attorney General, S.F. Phillips, regarding the case of William Wallace. Wallace, a Captain in the U.S. Marine Corps, had evidently brought suit against the Navy Department for its alleged non-payment of salary increments.

odd.p: Unprocessed collection. Cataloged from accession records.
